Post.title: To celebrate HIVE, the ENTRYPOINT community has decided to BREAK THE INTERNET
Post.excerpt:
Nobody on HIVE actually understands GRAPHENE or what it was originally intended to do.

Everybody is stuck in condenser clones.

What can one person do to liberate the blockchain from NPC's

EVERYTHING

Hive will be getting a #cms offering, brought to you by ENTRYPOINT and ONETHREETHREESEVEN

The hard working people that has, been adding real value to the hive platform since 2017 has cracked the code and now hive is ready to become YOUR OWN PERSONAL WEB PAGE

This is it ladies and gentleman bigger than wix, bigger than weebly, we're going to definitively corner the market on free decentralized web, once and for all.

HOW?

We have been developing a decentralized web offering called adaptogen, that offers people web hosting on ethvm platforms, and in developing the technology have discovered the fundamental crossover point between blockchain and web, we have developed an entirely new stack in the process that leverages traditional web technologies in a new way.

WHY?

Since we have recently finished work on school of minnows' relaunch, finished our 2 month moralis hackathon (a project that gave people cms and sales on avalanche called swagtag), developed our new peer to peer tech stack (called hyperbolic-code-server) and have recently launched a protype for evm called adaptogen, we have been researching porting all the wisdom gathered from these other networks to hive, to add value to our own use of the platform, and to allow other people to derive more value from it.

Value added services has allways been our game, and we've also learnt many important lessons about how to keep hosted services free with our school of minnows project, which originally ran on spare computers, and now runs permanently without incurring costs.

While ethvm blockchains give us the ability to have extremely cheap cms platforms leveraging existing strucutres, there is even more to gain by combining blogging and social networking with CMS and sales, and hive having a proven track record in indexing graphene's history there is a niche opportunity to give people access to a mainnet for free.

WHEN?

Since the technique itself is fundamentally simplistic, prototype models for the project can immediately be established and enter longer term development cycles, a codebase for porting adaptogen to make hive websites will be up in the next two weeks, paired with our existing stuctures, we will begin to offer people free hosting as an alternative way to display their hive activity, from that point onwards, the system should leave the public alpha that will be in place in two weeks time enter a beta phase in 12 months time, where creature comforts should be reaching finality and testing is more important than features.

HOW DO I SUPPORT THIS PROJECT?

Come and talk to us over at entrypoint, tell us what you want from it and lets build a better product!
https://discord.gg/NED33mNpms

Post.title: WHY IS EVERYTHING A BIG SECRET ON HIVE? .....\"I'll TELL YOU ON DISCORD\"
Post.excerpt:
"You're not on Discord? That's where is all goes down!"

Those are the words from @aggroed during the one brief conversation I had with him in Bangkok at the last steemfest event in 2019. I only understood the deeper meaning of this years later, but it always struck me as odd.

Even during my early days on steemit in 2017. People there were always saying, "let's talk on discord". At the time I never understood why that was so important. I've been told many times over the years that I'm about as honest, direct, and genuine as you get in this day in age. I'm a horrible liar and simply don't feel good being deceitful.

I enjoy and feel good about posting and commenting on the blockchain for all to see, perfectly transparent. I have nothing to hide. I thought you were supposed to converse on the "social media" blockchain, that way people can up-vote you too, and you can share information with everyone and they too can chime in on the "social media" blockchain!

I've always thought my presence there was to use the blockchain as the communication interface, not a totally separate platform. Why on earth is so much conversation on Hive actually not taking place on Hive? But instead a platform that is designed for private discrete conversations?

You can even see it here on Discord's homepage. (Image credit: discord)

"imagine a place where just you and a handful of friends can spend time together." Sounds like the total opposite of Hive, Blurt, or Steemit. Yet this is the preferred place for many on Hive to spend their time socializing. A private place, for just you and a few friends to talk privately. A place where you can keep secrets, plan, plot, scheme, abuse, threaten, and more without being seen on the public blockchain.

Now, I'm no fool. I understand some topics are personal and are only to be shared privately. But what I've seen on Hive especially after doing some research shows an entirely different picture; a true need for secrecy. The phrase @aggroed used that has been echoing in my head for years now is........ "Discord is where it all "GOES DOWN".

What the heck does that mean? What the heck is going down on discord? All the backroom shady deals? All the planning and scheming? The truth shared between the few, and a BS narrative for the masses to be misled and taken advantage of? Or maybe a private reaming, graveling, and boot licking session for the down-voted? Coordinated attacks on targeted accounts? Or how about racist attacks like I experienced in the Hive Watchers discord server like this one.

This really does not have to be a long post and maybe we should just wrap it up with a display of screen shots showing how they operate. Especially the down-vote enforcement arm of the "hive cabal" called hive-watchers.

This group who was voted into power and funded by the top witnesses on Hive use a satanic occult owl as their logo for Christ sake! It's led by another anonymous faceless top witness who goes by the bizarre name of @guiltyparties. He is a master of taking their dirty laundry to discord where it can not be seen by the public.

Here is a reply from an attempt of @guiltyparties to pull this individual into the private chats of Discord. This person certainly has a good understanding of what is going on. His name will remain private, and rest assured he has my utmost respect.

Now see top hive witness @themarkymark respond to this issue. Sounds like a whole lot of BS to me.

It's "logical" to take engagement off the blockchain?.....%80 of hive is on Discord? What?....

What kind of culture of secrecy do they have going on over there?

The "hive cabal" are mostly anonymous accounts. For Anonymous Marky Mark to spin this like it's a good thing is remarkable. What is "going down" that is so private that 80% of engagement/discussion needs be done on a private chat platform not Hive "social media" blockchain?

Until next time I will NOT see you on Discord. I'll see you on Blurt! Hope you all are having a wonderful day!

From Thailand, Dan "World Travel Pro!"

Post.title: who is lanmower anyway? my introduction post
Post.excerpt:
Hi I'm lanmower, what is a lanmower? a lanmower is a mower, that mows lans.

in more ways than one, I am the most active developer on this chain, I live in a communal decentralized organization online called entrypoint, we have been promoting hive and committing to a long-term onboarding process for new users over the past few years

if you're looking at my account you may notice that I'm being downvoted by @markymark and @buildawhale

The reason for it is that the whale users who are keeping a strangle hold on hive, like hyaenas on a carcass, wish to extract whatever value there is left on hive so that they can exit scam.

The proof, of course is in the immutable numbers on the blockchain, please have a look for yourself at their accounts, my account, my history, the history of the projects I run, the track record thereof and how many people have been helped by my active development for hive.

I was also the person who wrote the first layered token examples for this chain, the reason why I abandoned the project was, which was later copied by other popular projects, such as hive-engine, our community abandoned the project in search of more ethical solutions, but our examples got picked up by other users on hive, first a user who implemented a quasi-chain that was referenced over ipfs, and then the ssc project was later created that first used a cheap and dirty database, and later got ported to mongodb

Funny story about hive engine, they advertise it as decentralized, but did you know that its a centralized exchange? It's an interesting thing because the people who designed it knew that they could advocate for additional tokens to get opened up on the blockchain itself, allowing people to have real decentralized freedom, but instead made a centralized exchange out of some (very amateurish) javascript bots.

The house of cards we're all riding is shaking at its foundation, and everybodies change is landing in the custodians of the centralized bot that is holding your money, for real.

It's interesting then to know that the same people who chose to willingly demote my activity, on the premise that I work to advocate for respecting the original whitepaper that our communities were built on. That's right, I get downvoted for my beliefs, and for trying to help minnows grow.

That's ok though, because I do not fear censorship from the people who are trying to kill the blockchain for their own profit, the people who are actively farming over 99% of the voting pool for their own profit and the profit of their friends, provably, immutably, on record, they are supressing people who help minnows for their beliefs.
